title: Mark Chapter 7 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Mark chapter 7 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Mark Chapter 7 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Mark Chapter 7.

questions.question: Who came together to Jesus according to Mark 7:1?
options: Pharisees and certain scribes
Disciples and followers
Romans and soldiers
Sadducees and priests
questions.correctAnswer: Pharisees and certain scribes
questions.explanation: Mark 7:1 states that the Pharisees and certain scribes from Jerusalem came together to Jesus.

questions.question: What did the Pharisees find fault with in Mark 7:2?
options: Disciples eating with unwashen hands
Jesus speaking to the crowds
Disciples healing on the Sabbath
Jesus eating with sinners
questions.correctAnswer: Disciples eating with unwashen hands
questions.explanation: In Mark 7:2, the Pharisees found fault because Jesus' disciples ate bread with defiled, or unwashen, hands.

questions.question: According to Mark 7:3, what tradition do the Pharisees and all Jews hold about eating?
options: They must wash their hands often before eating
They must fast before meals
They eat only unleavened bread
They do not eat meat
questions.correctAnswer: They must wash their hands often before eating
questions.explanation: Mark 7:3 explains that Pharisees and Jews hold the tradition of washing hands often before eating.

questions.question: What did Jesus say defiles a man in Mark 7:15?
options: The things which come out of the man
Eating with unwashen hands
Touching unclean animals
The food from without
questions.correctAnswer: The things which come out of the man
questions.explanation: Mark 7:15 says that nothing from outside can defile a man, but the things that come out of him defile him.

questions.question: Who was the woman that came to Jesus in Mark 7:25?
options: A Greek, a Syrophenician by nation
A Samaritan woman
A Jewish widow
A Roman noblewoman
questions.correctAnswer: A Greek, a Syrophenician by nation
questions.explanation: Mark 7:26 describes the woman as a Greek, a Syrophenician by nation.

questions.question: What did Jesus say about the children and the bread in Mark 7:27?
options: Let the children first be filled
Give the bread to the poor
Share the bread with everyone
The bread is for the priests only
questions.correctAnswer: Let the children first be filled
questions.explanation: In Mark 7:27, Jesus said, 'Let the children first be filled,' referring to the priority of His ministry to the Jews first.

questions.question: What was the woman's response to Jesus in Mark 7:28?
options: Yes, Lord: yet the dogs under the table eat of the children's crumbs
No, Lord: only the children deserve the bread
Please heal my daughter without delay
I do not understand your words
questions.correctAnswer: Yes, Lord: yet the dogs under the table eat of the children's crumbs
questions.explanation: Mark 7:28 records the woman’s humble and witty reply about dogs eating crumbs under the table.

questions.question: What miracle did Jesus perform on the man brought to Him in Mark 7:32-35?
options: He healed the man who was deaf and had a speech impediment
He raised a man from the dead
He fed five thousand people
He calmed a storm
questions.correctAnswer: He healed the man who was deaf and had a speech impediment
questions.explanation: Mark 7:32-35 tells how Jesus healed a man who was deaf and had difficulty speaking.

questions.question: What command did Jesus give after healing the deaf man in Mark 7:36?
options: Not to tell anyone about the miracle
To tell everyone immediately
To follow Him into the city
To offer a sacrifice
questions.correctAnswer: Not to tell anyone about the miracle
questions.explanation: Jesus charged them to tell no one about the healing according to Mark 7:36.

questions.question: According to Mark 7:10, what did Moses command concerning parents?
options: Honour thy father and thy mother
Do not work on the Sabbath
Love your neighbor as yourself
Offer sacrifices daily
questions.correctAnswer: Honour thy father and thy mother
questions.explanation: Mark 7:10 quotes Moses commanding to honour father and mother.

questions.question: True or False: According to Mark 7:6, Jesus called the Pharisees hypocrites.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Mark 7:6 records Jesus calling the Pharisees hypocrites as He quoted Isaiah.

questions.question: True or False: According to Mark 7:14, Jesus called all the people to him and told them to listen and understand.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Mark 7:14 states Jesus called all the people and asked them to listen and understand.

questions.question: True or False: In Mark 7:13, Jesus condemned making the word of God ineffective through tradition.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Mark 7:13 speaks of making the word of God of no effect through tradition, which Jesus condemned.

questions.question: Complete the verse from Mark 7:16: 'If any man have ears to hear, let him ______.'
options: hear
speak
pray
listen
questions.correctAnswer: hear
questions.explanation: Mark 7:16 says, 'If any man have ears to hear, let him hear.'

questions.question: Complete this verse from Mark 7:21: 'For from within, out of the heart of men, proceed evil thoughts, adulteries, ______, murders,'
options: fornications
joys
songs
offerings
questions.correctAnswer: fornications
questions.explanation: Mark 7:21 lists evil things from the heart, including fornications.

medium.title: Mark Chapter 7 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Mark Chapter 7 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A believer is concerned about external rituals and wonders if these define true purity. Based on Mark 7, what biblical truth would you share about what truly defiles a person?
options: What comes out of a person defiles them, not what enters from outside
Only external cleanliness matters to God
Ritual washing is the key to spiritual purity
Following tradition is more important than the heart
questions.correctAnswer: What comes out of a person defiles them, not what enters from outside
questions.explanation: Mark 7:15, 7:20-23 teach that defilement comes from within a person—evil thoughts and actions—not from external things or rituals. This shows the importance of the heart over mere external observance.

questions.question: How does Mark 7 teach us about humility when Jesus addresses the Syrophenician woman who asked for her daughter's healing?
options: She humbly accepted Jesus’ words and trusted in His mercy
She demanded healing because she was worthy
She questioned Jesus’ authority openly
She ignored Jesus and sought another healer
questions.correctAnswer: She humbly accepted Jesus’ words and trusted in His mercy
questions.explanation: In Mark 7:27-28, the woman accepts Jesus’ metaphor about children and dogs but humbly insists even crumbs suffice. Her humility and faith led to her daughter's healing (7:29-30).

questions.question: A fellow believer struggles with traditions that contradict God’s commandments. What guidance does Mark 7 give about this situation?
options: Do not reject God’s commandments in order to keep man-made traditions
Man-made traditions are equal to God’s commandments
It is acceptable to keep traditions even if they contradict God’s word
Ignore both traditions and commandments to find your own way
questions.correctAnswer: Do not reject God’s commandments in order to keep man-made traditions
questions.explanation: Mark 7:8-9 explains that the Pharisees rejected God’s commandments to uphold traditions, which Jesus condemns. True obedience prioritizes God’s word over human traditions.

questions.question: How does the healing of the deaf and mute man in Mark 7 teach us about Jesus’ compassion and power in daily struggles?
options: Jesus lovingly heals and restores those with physical and spiritual needs
Jesus only heals after long public ceremonies
Jesus requires payment before healing
Jesus heals only those who are perfect
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus lovingly heals and restores those with physical and spiritual needs
questions.explanation: Mark 7:32-35 shows Jesus’ compassion in healing the man’s deafness and speech impediment, demonstrating His power to restore and encourage faith in practical life challenges.

questions.question: What does Jesus’ teaching in Mark 7 reveal about the importance of the heart in Christian conduct and integrity?
options: The heart is the source of evil or good, affecting true purity and behavior
Only outward actions matter, not the heart
Integrity depends on following traditions strictly
The heart is irrelevant to spiritual life
questions.correctAnswer: The heart is the source of evil or good, affecting true purity and behavior
questions.explanation: Mark 7:21-23 lists evil things coming from within the heart that defile a person, emphasizing that true Christian integrity begins internally, not externally.

questions.question: A parent is teaching their children about honoring family. Based on Mark 7, what biblical principle can you share about family obligations?
options: Honor your father and mother as commanded by God
Family obligations can be ignored when traditions say so
Only children should honor parents, not parents honor children
Family honor is less important than social customs
questions.correctAnswer: Honor your father and mother as commanded by God
questions.explanation: Mark 7:10-11 cites the commandment to honor father and mother, warning against traditions that nullify this duty, stressing the importance of family respect and responsibility.

questions.question: How does the response of the people after Jesus healed the deaf man encourage believers about sharing the Gospel and testimonies?
options: They spread the news widely, showing the power of testimony
They kept the miracle a secret as Jesus requested
They doubted the miracle and ignored it
They only told close family about it
questions.correctAnswer: They spread the news widely, showing the power of testimony
questions.explanation: Mark 7:36-37 shows that despite Jesus’ command, people widely shared the miracle, demonstrating the natural impulse to witness and evangelize when seeing God’s work.

questions.question: A believer feels condemned for not following all traditional religious customs. Based on Mark 7, what biblical truth can bring relief?
options: God values the heart and obedience to His commandments over mere traditions
Only perfect tradition keepers are accepted by God
External customs are the primary measure of faith
Traditions are above God’s word
questions.correctAnswer: God values the heart and obedience to His commandments over mere traditions
questions.explanation: Mark 7:6-8 emphasizes that God is honored by sincere hearts, not just lip service or ritual, correcting the emphasis on human traditions over divine commands.

questions.question: True or False: According to Mark 7, Jesus taught that washing hands before eating is necessary to avoid defilement.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Mark 7:2-4 shows the Pharisees criticized Jesus’ disciples for not washing hands, but Jesus corrected this by teaching in 7:15 and 7:18-19 that what enters does not defile, but what comes out defiles.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus stated that the tradition of declaring something "Corban" could nullify the commandment to honor one’s parents.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Mark 7:11-13 explains how the tradition of 'Corban' allowed people to avoid supporting their parents, effectively nullifying God’s commandment to honor father and mother.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Jesus said, "This people honorth me with their lips, but their ______ is far from me."
options: heart
actions
words
traditions
questions.correctAnswer: heart
questions.explanation: Mark 7:6 quotes Isaiah, emphasizing that true worship requires heartfelt devotion, not just outward words.

questions.question: A fellow believer struggles with evil thoughts and temptations from within. Based on Mark 7, what biblical truth would you share about overcoming these?
options: Evil thoughts come from the heart and defile us, so guarding the heart is crucial
Only external rituals can cleanse evil thoughts
Temptations are not related to the heart
Ignoring evil thoughts makes them go away
questions.correctAnswer: Evil thoughts come from the heart and defile us, so guarding the heart is crucial
questions.explanation: Mark 7:21-23 teaches that evil thoughts and actions come from within the heart and defile a person, highlighting the need for inner spiritual discipline.

questions.question: How does Mark 7 illustrate the role of faith and persistence in prayer through the story of the Syrophenician woman?
options: Her persistent faith and humble approach led to her daughter's healing
She gave up after the first refusal
She demanded a miracle without faith
She sought help from others instead of Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: Her persistent faith and humble approach led to her daughter's healing
questions.explanation: Mark 7:26-29 shows the woman’s humble persistence despite initial rejection, illustrating faith’s power in prayer and receiving God’s mercy.

questions.question: What does Mark 7 teach about the importance of understanding spiritual teachings rather than just hearing them?
options: Having ears to hear means truly understanding the spiritual message
Just hearing words is enough for spiritual growth
Understanding is not necessary if one attends church
Only leaders need to understand spiritual teachings
questions.correctAnswer: Having ears to hear means truly understanding the spiritual message
questions.explanation: Mark 7:16 and 7:18 indicate that hearing must be accompanied by understanding, stressing the need for spiritual discernment in applying God’s word.

questions.question: How does Jesus’ interaction with the deaf man in Mark 7 show the importance of personal attention in ministry and service?
options: Jesus took him aside to heal him privately, showing care and respect
Jesus healed him publicly to gain fame
Jesus ignored his condition at first
Jesus healed him without any personal interaction
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus took him aside to heal him privately, showing care and respect
questions.explanation: Mark 7:33 describes Jesus taking the man aside from the crowd to heal him, exemplifying compassionate, individualized ministry and respect for personal dignity.

hard.title: Mark Chapter 7 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Mark Chapter 7.

questions.question: In Mark 7:6, Jesus quotes Isaiah to rebuke the Pharisees, saying, 'This people honoureth me with their lips, but their heart is far from me.' What literary device is primarily used in this statement?
options: Irony
Parallelism
Chiasm
Typology
questions.correctAnswer: Parallelism
questions.explanation: Mark 7:6 uses parallelism, a common Hebrew poetic device, contrasting external lip service with internal heart distance to criticize hypocrisy.

questions.question: What is the significance of the term 'Corban' in Mark 7:11 in the context of Jewish tradition and Mosaic Law?
options: It refers to a gift dedicated to God, exempting it from being used for parental support
It is a ritual washing required before eating
It is a Pharisaic tradition of fasting
It denotes a ceremonial meal for priests
questions.correctAnswer: It refers to a gift dedicated to God, exempting it from being used for parental support
questions.explanation: Mark 7:11 explains 'Corban' as a dedication to God that frees a person from supporting parents, showing how traditions could nullify God's commandments (Mark 7:10-13).

questions.question: According to Mark 7:15, what is the source of defilement in a person?
options: The things that come out of a person
Eating with unwashen hands
Touching unclean objects
Following traditions of the elders
questions.correctAnswer: The things that come out of a person
questions.explanation: Mark 7:15 clarifies that defilement comes not from external sources but from what proceeds out of a person’s heart and actions.

questions.question: In Mark 7:19, Jesus declares that food passes into the belly and out of the body, thus cannot defile. How does this statement foreshadow the later Christian dietary freedom taught by Paul?
options: It anticipates the removal of dietary restrictions in Christ
It reinforces strict Jewish dietary laws
It emphasizes ritual purification before meals
It supports the tradition of the elders
questions.correctAnswer: It anticipates the removal of dietary restrictions in Christ
questions.explanation: Mark 7:19 foreshadows New Testament teachings like Romans 14 and 1 Corinthians 8, where dietary laws are seen as non-binding for Christians.

questions.question: What type of intertextual connection does Mark 7:10 make by referencing the commandment to honor father and mother?
options: Direct citation of Mosaic Law from Exodus
Allusion to the Psalms
Quotation of a prophecy from Isaiah
Reference to the Proverbs
questions.correctAnswer: Direct citation of Mosaic Law from Exodus
questions.explanation: Mark 7:10 cites the fifth commandment originally given in Exodus 20:12, showing Jesus' appeal to Mosaic Law against Pharisaic traditions.

questions.question: In Mark 7:27-28, Jesus uses the metaphor of children and dogs in his conversation with the Syrophenician woman. What cultural or literary significance does this metaphor carry?
options: It reflects Jewish-Gentile distinctions and challenges prevailing social boundaries
It praises Gentiles as equals to Jews
It describes the dietary habits of the region
It illustrates a common rabbinic teaching about animals
questions.correctAnswer: It reflects Jewish-Gentile distinctions and challenges prevailing social boundaries
questions.explanation: The children and dogs metaphor in Mark 7:27-28 highlights Jewish exclusivism and Jesus’ challenge of such barriers by ultimately healing a Gentile's daughter.

questions.question: How does the narrative of the healing of the deaf man in Mark 7:32-35 illustrate the theme of spiritual opening or enlightenment?
options: The physical opening of ears and loosening of tongue symbolizes spiritual receptiveness to Jesus' message
It only demonstrates Jesus' power over nature
It is a parable about obedience to laws
It reflects a historical event without spiritual meaning
questions.correctAnswer: The physical opening of ears and loosening of tongue symbolizes spiritual receptiveness to Jesus' message
questions.explanation: Mark 7:34-35 uses physical healing as a typology for opening hearts and minds to the gospel, a recurrent theme in Mark’s Gospel.

questions.question: True or False: In Mark 7:8, Jesus condemns the Pharisees for upholding God's commandments over the traditions of men.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Mark 7:8 states Jesus condemns the Pharisees for laying aside God's commandments in favor of human traditions, not the other way around.

questions.question: What is the primary theme developed through Jesus' confrontation with the Pharisees and scribes in Mark 7:1-13?
options: The conflict between divine law and human tradition
The establishment of new dietary laws
The importance of ritual washing
The rejection of Jewish customs entirely
questions.correctAnswer: The conflict between divine law and human tradition
questions.explanation: Mark 7:1-13 highlights how the Pharisees' traditions nullify God’s commandments, emphasizing the tension between divine law and human traditions.

questions.question: In Mark 7:21-22, a list of sinful behaviors is given as coming from within a person. Which of the following is NOT included in that list?
options: Adulteries
Blasphemy
Fasting
Covetousness
questions.correctAnswer: Fasting
questions.explanation: Mark 7:21-22 lists sins from the heart including adulteries, blasphemy, and covetousness, but fasting is not mentioned and is generally a religious practice.

questions.question: What is the significance of Jesus entering the borders of Tyre and Sidon in Mark 7:24 in terms of the Gospel's geographic and cultural expansion?
options: It marks Jesus’ ministry extending into Gentile territory
It signifies a retreat from Jewish people
It shows Jesus' compliance with Jewish purity laws
It indicates a return to Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: It marks Jesus’ ministry extending into Gentile territory
questions.explanation: Mark 7:24 places Jesus in Gentile regions, foreshadowing the Gospel’s outreach beyond Israel and the inclusion of Gentiles in salvation history.

questions.question: How does the healing of the Syrophenician woman’s daughter in Mark 7:29-30 serve as a typological foreshadowing in the Gospel narrative?
options: It foreshadows the inclusion of Gentiles in God's kingdom
It predicts the destruction of Jerusalem
It symbolizes the cleansing of the temple
It prefigures the resurrection of Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: It foreshadows the inclusion of Gentiles in God's kingdom
questions.explanation: Mark 7:29-30 shows Jesus responding to a Gentile woman's faith, symbolizing the breaking of ethnic barriers and Gospel inclusion.

questions.question: Which Greek word used in Mark 7:34 means 'Be opened,' and what is its significance in the healing of the deaf man?
options: Ephphatha; it signifies divine authority to open physical and spiritual senses
Amen; it confirms truth
Abba; it means father
Hosanna; it is a cry of praise
questions.correctAnswer: Ephphatha; it signifies divine authority to open physical and spiritual senses
questions.explanation: Mark 7:34 records Jesus saying 'Ephphatha,' an Aramaic term meaning 'Be opened,' symbolizing healing and spiritual enlightenment.

questions.question: In Mark 7:16, Jesus says, 'If any man have ears to hear, let him hear.' What is the rhetorical purpose of this phrase in the context of the chapter?
options: To emphasize the need for spiritual perception beyond physical hearing
To indicate a literal hearing test
To dismiss the crowd
To command silence
questions.correctAnswer: To emphasize the need for spiritual perception beyond physical hearing
questions.explanation: Mark 7:16 uses this phrase as a call for attentive and discerning listening to Jesus' deeper teaching beyond literal hearing.

questions.question: True or False: The reaction of the crowd to Jesus’ healing in Mark 7:37 indicates astonishment at His ability to heal both the deaf and dumb.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Mark 7:37 recounts the crowd’s amazement at Jesus’ works, affirming His power over deafness and speech impediments.

theological.title: Mark Chapter 7 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Mark Chapter 7 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What was the primary criticism the Pharisees and scribes had against Jesus' disciples in Mark 7?
options: They ate bread with unwashen hands
They did not attend synagogue regularly
They taught against the Law of Moses
They associated with Gentiles
questions.correctAnswer: They ate bread with unwashen hands
questions.explanation: Mark 7:2-5 records the Pharisees and scribes criticizing Jesus' disciples for eating bread with unwashed hands, emphasizing their concern for ritual purity as commanded by tradition, which Jesus later challenges. This highlights the conflict between tradition and true holiness (Isaiah 29:13; Matthew 15:2-3; Luke 11:37-38; Titus 1:14).

questions.question: According to Jesus in Mark 7, what truly defiles a person?
options: The things which come out of a person
Eating with unwashed hands
Not following the tradition of elders
Touching unclean objects
questions.correctAnswer: The things which come out of a person
questions.explanation: Mark 7:15 and 20-23 teach that defilement comes from within a person, from the heart and the evil thoughts and actions that proceed from it, rather than external ritualistic practices. This aligns with other biblical teachings emphasizing heart purity (Proverbs 4:23; Jeremiah 17:9; Matthew 15:11; James 4:8).

questions.question: Jesus accuses the Pharisees of holding to what instead of the commandment of God?
options: The tradition of men
The Law of Moses
The words of the prophets
The covenant of Abraham
questions.correctAnswer: The tradition of men
questions.explanation: In Mark 7:8-9, Jesus rebukes the Pharisees for prioritizing human traditions over God's commandments, showing a tension between divine revelation and human-imposed regulations, which is a recurring theme in both Old and New Testaments (Isaiah 29:13; Colossians 2:8; Matthew 15:9; Galatians 1:14).

questions.question: What Old Testament commandment does Jesus cite to illustrate how the Pharisees nullified God's word through tradition?
options: Honor your father and your mother
Do not murder
Keep the Sabbath holy
Love your neighbor as yourself
questions.correctAnswer: Honor your father and your mother
questions.explanation: Mark 7:10-13 references the command to honor one's parents, which the Pharisees nullify by allowing people to declare their possessions as Corban, thus avoiding supporting their parents. This illustrates the misuse of tradition against God's law (Exodus 20:12; Deuteronomy 5:16; Matthew 15:4-6; Ephesians 6:2).

questions.question: In Mark 7, Jesus quotes Isaiah to describe the Pharisees' hypocrisy. What does Isaiah say about their worship?
options: They honor God with their lips but hearts are far from Him
Their sacrifices are pleasing to God
They follow God's law perfectly
Their faith moves mountains
questions.correctAnswer: They honor God with their lips but hearts are far from Him
questions.explanation: Mark 7:6 quotes Isaiah 29:13 to expose the Pharisees' superficial worship, emphasizing the disconnect between outward religion and inward devotion, a theme echoed throughout Scripture (Psalm 51:16-17; Jeremiah 7:21-23; Matthew 23:27-28; Romans 1:21).

questions.question: What does Jesus declare about the food that enters a person from outside in Mark 7?
options: It cannot defile him because it enters the belly and is expelled
It makes the person unclean until they wash
It defiles the person spiritually
It must be avoided to remain holy
questions.correctAnswer: It cannot defile him because it enters the belly and is expelled
questions.explanation: Mark 7:18-19 explains that external food does not defile a person because it passes through the digestive system, which parallels Jesus' teaching that moral and spiritual defilement comes from within, a concept supported by Levitical purity laws and New Testament teachings (Leviticus 11; Matthew 15:11; Acts 10:15; Hebrews 9:13).

questions.question: Who was the woman who begged Jesus to cast out a demon from her daughter in Mark 7?
options: A Greek, a Syrophenician by nation
A Samaritan woman
A Jewish widow
A Gentile from Rome
questions.correctAnswer: A Greek, a Syrophenician by nation
questions.explanation: Mark 7:26 identifies the woman as a Greek Syrophenician, highlighting Jesus' ministry extending beyond Israel to Gentiles, a foreshadowing of the gospel's universal reach supported by passages such as Isaiah 49:6 and Acts 13:47.

questions.question: What analogy does Jesus use to explain His ministry priority when speaking to the Syrophenician woman?
options: Children must be fed first before giving to dogs
Sheep must be gathered before lambs
The vineyard is for the chosen people first
The bride must be honored before the guests
questions.correctAnswer: Children must be fed first before giving to dogs
questions.explanation: In Mark 7:27, Jesus uses the metaphor of children and dogs to indicate His primary mission to Israel first, though later extending mercy to Gentiles, consistent with God's covenantal plan (Romans 11:11-12; Matthew 10:5-6; Luke 4:24-27; John 10:16).

questions.question: How does the Syrophenician woman respond to Jesus' analogy about children and dogs?
options: She says even the dogs eat the children's crumbs
She asks for a sign to prove His power
She insists her daughter is more important than the children
She leaves in anger
questions.correctAnswer: She says even the dogs eat the children's crumbs
questions.explanation: Mark 7:28 shows the woman's humility and faith by accepting Jesus' metaphor yet demonstrating that Gentiles can share in God's blessings, foreshadowing the inclusion of Gentiles in the kingdom (Romans 15:27; Galatians 3:28; Ephesians 2:11-22; Acts 10:34-35).

questions.question: What miracle did Jesus perform for the man who was deaf and had a speech impediment in Mark 7?
options: He opened his ears and loosened his tongue
He healed his blindness
He cast out an unclean spirit
He made him walk
questions.correctAnswer: He opened his ears and loosened his tongue
questions.explanation: Mark 7:33-35 describes Jesus healing the deaf man and enabling him to speak, demonstrating His authority over physical afflictions and foreshadowing spiritual restoration (Isaiah 35:5-6; Luke 4:18; Acts 3:6-8; John 9:1-7).

questions.question: What command did Jesus give when healing the deaf man in Mark 7, and what was the response of the people?
options: He told them not to tell anyone, but they spread the news widely
He told them to tell everyone immediately, and they obeyed
He told them to offer sacrifices, but they refused
He asked them to keep the miracle secret, and they kept quiet
questions.correctAnswer: He told them not to tell anyone, but they spread the news widely
questions.explanation: Mark 7:36 shows Jesus instructing silence regarding the miracle, but the people widely proclaimed it, illustrating the tension between Jesus' Messianic secret and the public recognition of His works (Mark 1:34; Matthew 12:16-21; John 7:3-5; Luke 5:14).

questions.question: Which of the following sins does Jesus mention as coming from within the heart that defiles a person in Mark 7?
options: Adulteries
Keeping the Sabbath
Tithing
Fasting
questions.correctAnswer: Adulteries
questions.explanation: Mark 7:21-22 lists 'adulteries' among the evil things that proceed from the heart and defile a person, emphasizing internal moral corruption as the root of sin (Jeremiah 17:9; Matthew 5:27-28; Romans 7:7-8; James 1:14-15).

questions.question: What does Jesus mean by saying 'If any man have ears to hear, let him hear' in Mark 7?
options: He is calling for attentive and obedient listening
He is speaking only to the Pharisees
He is asking for silence
He is concluding a parable
questions.correctAnswer: He is calling for attentive and obedient listening
questions.explanation: Mark 7:16 is an exhortation to spiritual attentiveness, encouraging the audience to understand and embrace His teaching, a phrase used frequently to stress the importance of discernment (Matthew 11:15; Luke 8:8; Revelation 2:7; Proverbs 2:2).

questions.question: How does Mark 7 depict Jesus' attitude toward public recognition after performing miracles?
options: He often instructed silence but was widely recognized
He sought public acclaim for His works
He performed miracles only in secret
He refused to heal non-Jews
questions.correctAnswer: He often instructed silence but was widely recognized
questions.explanation: Mark 7:36-37 demonstrates Jesus instructing people not to tell anyone about the miracles, yet the news spread widely, illustrating His Messianic secret motif and humility (Mark 1:34; Luke 5:14; John 6:15-16; Psalm 115:1).

questions.question: What theological theme is emphasized by Jesus' confrontation with the Pharisees over traditions in Mark 7?
options: The supremacy of God's commandments over human traditions
The necessity of ritual purity for salvation
The importance of strict adherence to laws for holiness
The rejection of the Old Testament Law
questions.correctAnswer: The supremacy of God's commandments over human traditions
questions.explanation: Mark 7:8-9 highlights Jesus' emphasis on God's commandments as supreme over man-made traditions, underscoring biblical theology about divine authority (Deuteronomy 12:32; Matthew 15:3-6; Colossians 2:20-22; Galatians 1:6-9).
